a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan:
Share of respondents agreeing with the statement "Most people can be trusted". The
Gini coefficient
measures
inequality on a scale from 0 to 1. Higher values indicate higher inequality.
Share agreeing "Most people can be trusted"
Data source: Integrated Values Surveys (2022); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)
Note: For each country, trust data is shown for the latest survey wave in the period 2009-2022. Depending on the country and year, inequality

data relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption,
per capita
.
